    <title>James Caan CBE:  Why Do People Move Jobs?</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/james-caan/why-do-people-move-jobs_b_9924882.html" />

    <author>

        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/james-caan/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Given how competitive it is to recruit top talent in today's market, it's important as an employer to think about these things before you begin your search for employees. To hire the best, you need to offer the best and that starts with refining you're offering for them and not just looking at the hiring process as a one way street.

    <title>Mary Creagh:  The Abolition of Roaming Charges Is Yet More Evidence of How Britain Is Better Off in the EU</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/mary-creagh/roaming-charges-eu_b_9804746.html" />

        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/mary-creagh/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Saturday marks a milestone for the travel industry and for business people and holidaymakers alike. Mobile phone roaming charges are being slashed by almost three quarters. From 15 June 2017, there will be no roaming charges in Europe at all. And it's all thanks to the EU.

    <title>Martin Whitlock:  Productivity in Crisis - Armies of Middlemen Living on the Backs of the Productive Few</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/martin-whitlock/productivity-in-crisis-ar_b_9781350.html" />

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Productivity is the measure of GDP per hour worked. Traditionally, it grows by introducing new methods and technologies, so that a given quantity of goods or services can be provided by a smaller number of people. This frees up other people to create more new wealth.

    <title>Chris Hirst:  My Challenge to You, Mr Gove</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/chris-hirst/my-challenge-to-you-mr-go_b_9746572.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/chris-hirst/my-challenge-to-you-mr-go_b_9746572.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-21T04:55:24Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-21T05:56:05Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Chris Hirst</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/chris-hirst/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I listened to you speak with respect and fear in equal measure this week. Your oratory skills are impressive and at times, your rhetoric is certainly convincing. The problem is, I just don't believe WHAT you're saying.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/eu-referendum">EU Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/michael-gove">Michael Gove</a>, <a href="/tag/brexit">Brexit</a>, <a href="/tag/referendum">Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/referendum-brexit">Referendum Brexit</a>, <a href="/tag/george-osborne">George Osborne</a>, <a href="/tag/economics">Economics</a>, <a href="/tag/economy">Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-economy">UK Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/business">Business</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-business">UK Business</a>, <a href="/tag/advertising">Advertising</a>, <a href="/tag/fear">Fear</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

            </entry> <entry>
    <title>Luke Springthorpe:  The Future of Europe's Young Is Being Sacrificed on the Altar of the EU Project</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/luke-springthorpe/eu-referendum_b_9730482.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/luke-springthorpe/eu-referendum_b_9730482.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-19T13:30:20Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-21T05:25:33Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Luke Springthorpe</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/luke-springthorpe/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Co-operation and trading on mutually beneficial terms are things we should preserve. The march towards standardisation and one size fits all solutions for a vastly disparate continent must come to an end, however. We cannot continue to sacrifice the prospects of Europe's young on the altar of this failing political experiment.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/young-people">Young People</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-referendum">EU Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/eu">Eu</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-reform">Eu Reform</a>, <a href="/tag/youth-unemployment">Youth Unemployment</a>, <a href="/tag/david-cameron-europe">David Cameron Europe</a>, <a href="/tag/david-cameron">David Cameron</a>, <a href="/tag/boris-johnson">Boris Johnson</a>, <a href="/tag/vote-leave">Vote Leave</a>, <a href="/tag/britain-stronger-in-europe">Britain-Stronger-in-Europe</a>, <a href="/tag/better-off-out">Better-Off-Out</a>, <a href="/tag/economy">Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/unemployment">Unemployment</a>, <a href="/tag/eurozone">Eurozone</a>, <a href="/tag/eurozone-crisis">Eurozone Crisis</a>, <a href="/tag/eurozone-economy">Eurozone Economy</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

   
        
	            <link href="http://i.huffpost.com/gen/4195618/images/s-EU-FLAG-DAMAGED-154x114.jpg" type="image/jpeg" rel="enclosure"/>
            </entry> <entry>
    <title>Seema Malhotra:  Why John Longworth Is Wrong and Why It's Right for Business That We Remain</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/seema-malhotra/eu-referendum-business_b_9746224.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/seema-malhotra/eu-referendum-business_b_9746224.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-21T03:03:52Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-21T03:06:52Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Seema Malhotra</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/seema-malhotra/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I have a good deal of respect for the work that Longworth did at the British Chambers of Commerce. He was a trenchant critic of the Government's failure to rebalance the economy towards infrastructure, exports and the region. But on the European Union, he could not be more wrong.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/seema-malhotra">Seema Malhotra</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-referendum">EU Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/john-longworth">John Longworth</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-business">UK Business</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-economy">UK Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-labour-party">UK Labour Party</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

   
        
	            <link href="http://i.huffpost.com/gen/3935768/images/s-SEEMA-MALHOTRA-154x114.jpg" type="image/jpeg" rel="enclosure"/>
            </entry> <entry>
    <title>Michael Gove:  The Facts of Life Say Leave: Why Britain and Europe Will Be Better Off After We Vote Leave</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/michael-gove/michael-gove-vote-leave_b_9728548.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/michael-gove/michael-gove-vote-leave_b_9728548.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-19T15:59:59Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-19T11:02:36Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Michael Gove</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/michael-gove/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I sometimes think that the In campaign appears to be operating to a script written by George R.R Martin and Stephen King - Brexit would mean a combination of a <em>Feast for Crows</em> and <em>Misery</em>. It's a deeply pessimistic view of the British people's potential and a profoundly negative vision of the future which isn't rooted in reality. The idea that if Britain voted to leave the European Union we would instantly become some sort of hermit kingdom, a North Atlantic North Korea only without that country's fund of international good will, is a fantasy, a phantom, a great, grotesque patronising and preposterous Peter Mandelsonian conceit...
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/michael-gove">Michael Gove</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-politics">UK Politics</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-conservative-party">UK Conservative Party</a>, <a href="/tag/vote-leave">Vote Leave</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-economy">UK Economy</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

   
        
	            <link href="http://i.huffpost.com/gen/4233930/images/s-MICHAEL-GOVE-154x114.jpg" type="image/jpeg" rel="enclosure"/>
            </entry> <entry>
    <title>John Healey:  The Government's Housing Plans Are a Mess</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/john-healey/housing-bill_b_9688932.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/john-healey/housing-bill_b_9688932.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-14T04:29:00Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-14T04:31:22Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>John Healey</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/john-healey/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        As Labour continues to expose and oppose the worst elements of this Housing Bill, Ministers face losing more votes, But much more damaging is the public losing any confidence that the government is competent to fix this housing crisis.

    <title>Dave Prentis:  Our Union Is Far From Pro-EU, But We Will Campaign to Stay In and Reform It for Working People</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/dave-prentis/eu-referendum_b_9688902.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/dave-prentis/eu-referendum_b_9688902.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-13T19:00:00Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-14T04:24:40Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Dave Prentis</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/dave-prentis/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I will be voting to remain in Europe, and Unison will be encouraging its 1.3million members to do the same, following a comprehensive survey involving 60,000 of them... That position is something of a change of direction. Our union is not and has never been pro-EU. On the contrary, we've opposed decades of EU treaties - from Maastricht to Lisbon to the EU constitution - and have repeatedly warned against the slow drift towards dogmatic austerity across the continent. We'll continue to make these arguments.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/uk-politics">UK Politics</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-referendum">EU Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/unison">Unison</a>, <a href="/tag/dave-prentis">Dave Prentis</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-economy">UK Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-business">UK Business</a>, <a href="/tag/trade-unions">Trade Unions</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Tax is an emotive issue.  Tinkering with the tax system by UK Chancellors over the last 30 years has created one of the most complex tax systems in the world.  There is a very strong argument now for a complete overhaul of the system to ensure clarity and fairness.

    <title>Kate Hoey:  The TUC Should Not Be Teaming Up With the Agents of Project Fear</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/kate-hoey/eu-referendum-tuc-project-fear_b_9668176.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/kate-hoey/eu-referendum-tuc-project-fear_b_9668176.html</id>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        It is very disappointing to see the TUC teaming up with the Government and multinational business to promote Project Fear. It is a common feature of pro-EU arguments that rather than attempt to say positive things about the EU, they instead scaremonger about what could or might happen were we a fully sovereign nation again.

    <title>Ryan Barrell:  Saturday's Protest Proved David Cameron Won't Be Resigning Any Time Soon</title>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        If you're one of the people who wants to capitalise on Cameron's offshore tax affairs to get your way, take a moment to think about how you're going about it - because what he has admitted to so far probably won't be enough to get the moderate majority to march alongside you. So if you think Cameron will be going the way of Iceland's PM any time soon, don't hold your breath.

    <title>Jess Phillips:  If I Were King of the Forest - The Tale of a Cowardly Lion</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/jess-phillips/david-cameron-offshore-tax_b_9640604.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/jess-phillips/david-cameron-offshore-tax_b_9640604.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-07T19:00:00Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-08T04:48:13Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Jess Phillips</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/jess-phillips/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Day one of the Panama papers scandal was Cameron's chance to be a grown up. He had a chance to say that he had invested in offshore funds in the past. He had the chance to say sorry. Even better, he has the actual power to change his behaviour and commit to improving the regulation on this sort of avoidance... It is really, really hard to say if you've made a mistake. It takes courage. The UK Prime Minister had a chance to show courage, he had a chance to give us some faith in politicians. Instead he was a coward. A coward who cheats. Same old same old. We deserve better.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/uk-politics">UK Politics</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-labour-party">UK Labour Party</a>, <a href="/tag/jess-phillips">Jess Phillips</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-economy">UK Economy</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-business">UK Business</a>, <a href="/tag/panama-papers">Panama Papers</a>, <a href="/tag/offshore-tax">Offshore Tax</a>, <a href="/tag/david-cameron">David Cameron</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>
